items.title: United Airlines gains approval for first Starlink-equipped planes
items.summary:
- United Airlines has received FAA approval for its first aircraft equipped with Starlink technology.
- The Embraer 175 is the first model to obtain a Supplemental Type Certificate, with deployment set for May.
- United plans to install Starlink on approximately 40 regional jets monthly, aiming for complete installation on 300 Embraer 175 planes by year-end.
- The airline is also pursuing FAA approval for over 16 additional aircraft models in collaboration with Starlink.

items.title: Xiaomi’s first EV model achieves 29k March deliveries
items.summary:
- Xiaomi delivered over 29,000 units of its first electric vehicle, the SU7, in March.
- The company aims for an annual delivery target of 350,000 units.
- This milestone marks a significant achievement for Xiaomi Auto, which has been in the EV market for only one year.
- Production ramp-up is on track, indicating confidence in meeting full-year goals.
- Recent developments include plans to expand the EV factory in Beijing and a $5.27 billion share placement for expansion and tech investment.

items.title: France fines Apple $162m over app tracking transparency
items.summary:
- France's Competition Authority fined Apple 150 million euros (US$162 million) for its App Tracking Transparency (ATT) feature.
- The authority claims ATT unfairly disadvantages third-party publishers and advertising services.
- ATT, introduced in 2021, requires user consent for tracking users across apps and websites, limiting data access for targeted ads if declined.
- Apple argues that ATT enhances user privacy and control.

items.title: Facebook Ads Promote Illegal West Bank Settlements
items.summary:
- Al Jazeera's investigation revealed over 100 Facebook ads promoting illegal settlements and far-right activities in the West Bank.
- Ads included calls for demolishing Palestinian homes and fundraising for Israeli military units in Gaza.
- Meta, Facebook's parent company, stated the ads were reviewed but did not clarify if promoting illegal settlements violated their standards.
- Investigation found 52 ads from Israeli companies selling properties in West Bank settlements, targeting buyers in Israel, the UK, and the US.
- Meta's ad review system may have failed to detect the illegal content due to its reliance on both automated technology and human oversight.

items.title: A list of fundraising startups from Asia and beyond (Updated)
items.summary:
- A curated list of fundraising startups for subscribers is offered.
- Startups can sign up for listing to attract investors through email notifications.
- Investors can receive curated listings of fundraising startups through subscription.
- The article suggests reaching out if a startup succeeds in fundraising for potential coverage.

items.title: Foxconn to double iPhone production in India to 30 million units
items.summary:
- Foxconn plans to double iPhone production in India to 25-30 million units by 2025.
- The Bengaluru facility is being tested for large-scale production capabilities.
- The facility will have the capacity to assemble 20 million smartphones annually.
- Foxconn is investing 25,000 crore rupees (US$3 million) into the Bengaluru plant, making it the largest in India and the second largest globally.

items.title: Yahoo appoints ex-Paramount exec as new chief marketing officer
items.summary:
- Yahoo has appointed a former Paramount executive as its new Chief Marketing Officer.
- The decision aims to enhance Yahoo's marketing strategy and brand positioning.
- This move comes as part of Yahoo's ongoing efforts to revitalize its brand and improve market competitiveness.

items.title: Japan boosts funding by $5.4b for Rapidus advanced chip push
items.summary:
- The Japanese government has announced an additional 800 billion yen (US$5.4 billion) for Rapidus, increasing total support to US$11.5 billion.
- Rapidus plans to mass-produce advanced 2-nanometer chips, with prototype production starting in April at its Hokkaido facility.
- The funding will assist in acquiring equipment, raw materials, and implementing production technologies.
- Japan's industry ministry confirmed the funds aim to strengthen Rapidus’ production capabilities.
- A proposed bill could make the government a shareholder in Rapidus and allocate an additional 100 billion yen (US$668 million) if passed.

items.title: Ola Electric boosts battery, EV charging units with fresh funding
items.summary:
- Ola Electric secures 199 crore rupees (US$23.3 million) funding for its battery subsidiary, Ola Cell Technologies (OCT).
- The funding will convert 61.2 crore (US$7.2 million) in outstanding payables into compulsory convertible preference shares (CCPS).
- Ola Electric is also investing 3.5 crore rupees (US$410,000) into its charging infrastructure subsidiary, Ola Electric Charging (OEC).

items.title: Taiwan to rank among top semiconductor equipment spenders
items.summary:
- Taiwan is projected to be among the top spenders on semiconductor equipment globally.
- The rise in spending is attributed to increasing demand for advanced chips.
- This reflects Taiwan's significant position in the global semiconductor supply chain.

items.title: Companies reevaluate DEI initiatives during Trump policies
items.summary:
- Many US companies are reevaluating their Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) initiatives in response to President Trump’s policies.
- Changes include modifications in hiring practices and employee resource groups.
- Companies like Google and McDonald’s have adjusted their DEI programs to align with the current administration’s stance and to comply with new regulations.

items.title: US-based microservices platform Temporal raises $146m series C
items.summary:
- Seattle-based Temporal raised US$146 million in Series C funding led by Tiger Global.
- The funding round brings total funding to US$350 million and values the company at US$1.72 billion.
- Temporal specializes in microservices orchestration, aiding businesses in streamlining payment processing and infrastructure management.
- New funds will be allocated for R&D, AI initiatives, cloud services for Azure, and expanding sales and marketing.
- Notable users of Temporal’s platform include Nvidia, Box, Snap, Stripe, and Instacart.

items.title: NFT marketplace X2Y2 to shut down by April 2025
items.author: TP
items.summary:
- X2Y2, an NFT marketplace launched in February 2022, will shut down on April 30, 2025.
- Announcement made by pseudonymous founder TP in a blog post.
- Shutdown follows declining trading volumes and competition from platforms like Blur.
- X2Y2's peak monthly trading volume was US$209 million in May 2022.
- The NFT market has experienced a 90% drop in overall trading since 2021.
- X2Y2's smart contracts will remain active post-shutdown, allowing user interaction.

items.title: Nvidia-backed AI firm’s stock falls 7% below IPO price to $37
items.summary:
- CoreWeave’s stock fell 7% to US$37, below its IPO price of US$40.
- The company debuted at US$39 and closed at US$40 on Mar. 28.
- CoreWeave raised US$1.5 billion in its IPO, the largest tech listing since UiPath's US$1.57 billion in 2021.
- It is the first AI-focused firm to go public in a slow IPO market.
- Initially aimed to raise US$2.5 billion at a per share price of US$47-US$55 but reduced its offering to 37.5 million shares from 49 million due to market conditions.

items.title: Israeli foodtech startup PoLoPo develops potato-based egg protein
items.summary:
- PoLoPo is developing plant-based technology to produce egg proteins using genetically engineered potatoes.
- The startup has completed its first field trial, yielding five tons of protein-rich potatoes.
- It generates several hundred grams of protein samples monthly for initial collaborations with food companies.
- The company aims to create a stable egg protein supply to reduce disruptions like bird flu outbreaks.
- PoLoPo plans to expand to the US, with its first field trial scheduled for 2026.

items.title: Swedish EV battery firm Northvolt cuts workforce to 1,700
items.summary:
- Northvolt AB is in bankruptcy, reducing its workforce from 7,000 to 1,700 employees.
- Operations have been scaled back to facilitate a potential sale of the business.
- The company recently put its assets up for sale under court direction.
- Founded in 2016, Northvolt raised around US$10 billion but faced significant operational challenges and rising liabilities.

items.title: Australian software firm appoints directors for compliance
items.summary:
- WiseTech Global has appointed Chris Charlton and Andrew Harrison as independent non-executive directors to its board.
- The appointments restore compliance with exchange regulations for its audit and risk committee.
- This follows a breach of listing rules due to the departure of four independent non-executive directors, including former Chairman Richard Dammery, occurring after the company's half-year results in February.

items.title: Indian edtech firm PlanetSpark achieves cash-flow positivity
items.summary:
- PlanetSpark, backed by Flipkart co-founder Binny Bansal, achieved cash-flow positivity in FY25.
- The startup focuses on teaching communication skills to children and professionals.
- Losses reduced by 70% from 89.5 crore rupees (US$10.5 million) in FY23 to 26.6 crore rupees (US$3.1 million) in FY24.
- Revenue grew 60% year-on-year to 67 crore rupees (US$7.8 million).
- Growth attributed to cost-cutting, customer referrals, and in-house content production.
- AI adoption enabled personalized learning, automated scoring, and improved content delivery.

items.title: US AI chipmaker secures approval on UAE ties ahead of IPO
items.summary:
- US-based Cerebras Systems Inc. resolved issues with CFIUS, clearing a hurdle for IPO plans.
- The review focused on ties to Abu Dhabi-based G42, which accounted for over 80% of revenue.
- The deal was modified to limit G42 to non-voting shares to avoid further scrutiny.
- Restrictions on AI investments from the Middle East have tightened due to national security concerns.
- Cerebras’ partnership with G42 established data centers in California, Texas, and Minnesota.
- G42 contributed 87% of revenue in early 2024, necessitating US government approval for part of the business.
- Reports suggest the IPO could raise up to US$1 billion, valuing the company at US$7 billion to US$8 billion.

items.title: Korean AI startup Wrtn raises $73.5m series B
items.summary:
- Wrtn, a South Korean AI startup, raised 108 billion won (US$73.5 million) in Series B funding announced on Mar. 31.
- This funding sets a record as the first Korean AI service platform outside of large-language models and semiconductors to exceed 100 billion won in total investments.
- Investment includes 83 billion won from the Series B round and 25 billion won from a pre-Series B round nine months prior.
- Key investors include Goodwater Capital, BRV Capital Management, Capstone Partners, among others.
- Wrtn's chat-based AI service has grown rapidly, achieving over 5 million monthly active users by October 2024.
- Monthly sales increased from 1 billion won in November 2023 to 2 billion won in December 2023.

items.title: Trump optimistic about TikTok deal before deadline
items.summary:
- President Donald Trump believes a deal for TikTok's sale may be completed before the April 5 deadline.
- The deadline, established by a 2024 law, requires TikTok to secure a non-Chinese buyer due to national security concerns.
- Trump mentioned optimism in negotiations, indicating there are potential buyers for TikTok's US operations.
- Blackstone and other non-Chinese stakeholders are reportedly leading the bid for TikTok.

items.title: Baidu’s Apollo Go, UAE mobility firm partner for driverless fleet
items.summary:
- Baidu’s Apollo Go partners with UAE-based Autogo for the largest driverless fleet in Abu Dhabi.
- Initial trials with autonomous vehicles to begin in select areas, aiming for full operations by 2026.
- Partnership ensures regulatory compliance with Abu Dhabi’s Integrated Transport Centre for smart mobility goals.
- Apollo Go, China's largest robotaxi platform, operates in over 10 cities and has a pilot license in Hong Kong.
- Service has completed 150 million kilometers and 10 million rides globally, promoting all-electric transport and reducing emissions.

items.title: TSMC to add 7,000 tech jobs with new chip plant in Taiwan
items.summary:
- Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC) is creating 7,000 new technology jobs with a fabrication plant in Kaohsiung, Taiwan.
- The facility will produce advanced 2-nanometer chips, with volume production starting in the second half of this year.
- TSMC reaffirms commitment to Taiwan as its core operational base despite global expansion efforts.
- Taiwan Premier Cho Jung-tai emphasizes TSMC’s importance to the national economy and its role as a supplier for companies like Nvidia, Apple, and Qualcomm.
- The new plant aims to address the rising global demand for semiconductors amidst geopolitical concerns.

items.title: A super angel’s guide to being on the better side of fundraising
items.summary:
- Fundraising is currently very challenging due to a significant market downturn, the first major correction in 15 years.
- Less than 1% of startups get funded, highlighting the competitive nature of fundraising.
- Founders often lack an investor's perspective, leading to ineffective approaches that feel objectifying to investors.
- 95% of funding attrition happens within a minute based on how founders approach investors.
- Optimizing the approach to investors is crucial and can be controlled by the founders without major shifts in their business.

items.title: The top lenders to SEA’s and India’s tech companies
items.summary:
- Debt is becoming popular among tech companies in Southeast Asia and India, with investors interested in meeting this demand.
- Granite Asia, a Singapore-based VC firm, is backing founders using a combination of equity and debt.
- Although debt has become more expensive due to higher interest rates, it is appealing to tech firms that are not suited for venture capital, focusing on sustainable growth instead.
- The article provides data on the top lenders to tech companies in Southeast Asia and India over the past six years, serving as a resource for executives seeking growth capital.

items.title: Granite Asia, Japan’s Integral Corporation form joint venture
items.summary:
- Granite Asia and Japan's Integral Corporation announced a joint venture named Granite-Integral on Mar. 31, focusing on cross-border investments in Japan.
- The initiative has an initial capital commitment of US$100 million, with equal contributions from both companies.
- The venture aims to support high-growth tech companies entering Japan and assist Japanese firms in expanding into Southeast Asia and other growth markets.
- Integral’s tech-focused investment arm will play a significant role in the joint venture, addressing regulatory and cultural challenges for global tech companies in Japan.
- Granite-Integral will be co-led by CK Choun and Joe Yan, both experienced in cross-border investments and technology scaling.
- Granite Asia manages US$5 billion in assets and is based in Singapore, while Integral Corporation is a Tokyo-listed private equity firm.

items.title: BYD denies report of Indian EV plant investment
items.summary:
- BYD has denied claims of establishing a manufacturing plant in India, calling the reports “untrue.”
- Local media claimed BYD would invest about 10 billion yuan (approximately US$1.4 billion) in Hyderabad, Telangana.
- BYD emphasized that no investment deal is currently in place despite its interest in international expansion, which includes Southeast Asia, South America, and Europe.

items.title: DingTalk founder returns as CEO, marking Alibaba’s new AI push
Taobao invests $1.5b in livestreaming to double users by 2027
items.summary:
- Taobao announced an investment of 11 billion yuan (US$1.5 billion) in its livestreaming unit, Taobao Live, for 2025.
- The goal is to double gross merchandise volume and user base by 2027, focusing on user acquisition, curated products, and support for professional streamers.
- The platform surpassed 200 million annual active buyers in 2024, with significant growth in transactions from top streamers and merchant-run livestream sales.

items.title: Li Auto aims for 700k sales in 2025
items.summary:
- Li Auto plans to achieve 700,000 vehicle sales by 2025.
- The company focuses on expanding its electric vehicle market share.
- Aims to increase production capacity to meet anticipated demand.

items.title: Yat Siu’s never gonna give Web3 up
items.summary:
- Yat Siu, co-founder of Animoca Brands, remains optimistic about Web3 despite industry setbacks.
- Animoca Brands saw a rebound of over 12% in bookings a year after a 2023 drop due to the FTX incident.
- The company's success is attributed to diversification across multiple Web3-related revenue streams.
- The attitude of western game developers towards Web3 may change with future regulatory support from the Trump administration.

items.title: Cut the chitchat: can AI help me or not?
items.author: Jofie
items.summary:
- Many companies are using AI chatbots to improve customer service, but 73% of customers are dissatisfied with their experiences.
- Lianne Dehaye from TDCX AI discusses common pitfalls, highlighting the importance of choosing effective chatbot options and incorporating emotion-sensing AI.
- Indonesia plans to introduce AI as a subject in schools to keep pace with global trends, focusing on ethical implications and skill development for students.

items.title: Microsoft partners UAE big data firm for AI startup accelerator
items.summary:
- Presight, a UAE-based big data analytics firm, signed an MoU with Microsoft for an AI startup accelerator.
- The initiative aims to support AI startups with access to technology, mentorship, and venture funding.
- Microsoft will provide resources through its Founders Hub, including cloud services and technical guidance.
- Startups will receive mentorship and market strategy insights from Microsoft's network.
- Applications for the Presight AI-Startup Accelerator close on April 10, 2025.

items.title: Chinese chip equipment firm unveils 30 locally made chip tools
items.summary:
- SiCarrier introduced 30 new chip tools at Semicon China 2025, focusing on domestic control for semiconductor self-sufficiency.
- The company will mass-produce tools for diffusion, etching, and thin film applications, emphasizing alternative materials and 3D architecture.
- SiCarrier's tools incorporate fully localized core components, indicating progress in an industry historically reliant on foreign technology.

items.title: Abu Dhabi’s ADQ acquires 63% stake in Dubai courier firm Aramex
items.summary:
- Abu Dhabi sovereign investor ADQ acquires a 63.26% stake in Aramex through Q Logistics Holding.
- Q Logistics secured 40.57% of Aramex shares, adding to ADQ’s existing 22.69% stake, surpassing UAE M&A requirements.
- The offer was priced at 3 dirham (US$0.82) per share, valuing Aramex at 4.39 billion dirham (US$1.2 billion).
- Aramex shares rose 1.81% post-announcement.
- ADQ’s acquisition aims to strengthen its transport and logistics portfolio, which includes companies like Abu Dhabi Ports Company and Etihad Airways.

items.title: Tencent, Alibaba introduce AI tools for farming in rural China
items.summary:
- Rural communities in China are adopting AI for farming, pest control, and ecommerce due to increased internet access and mobile phone usage.
- Tencent and Alibaba are at the forefront of this transition, offering tools like Tencent’s chatbot Yuanbao and Alibaba’s Tongyi for various agricultural needs.
- A village chief in Jiaohe, Jilin, implemented AI tools for farming advice, livestock management, and online promotions in collaboration with Tencent.
- Tencent's "AI Goes Rural" program aims to make AI solutions more relevant for rural areas, working alongside local officials.
- Alibaba's partnership with the Zhejiang provincial government focuses on integrating AI to tackle rural challenges.

items.title: Samsung Bespoke AI fridge locates phones, adjusts to weather
items.summary:
- Samsung has introduced the Bespoke AI fridge that can locate lost phones.
- The fridge adjusts its internal temperature based on real-time weather conditions.
- This innovation showcases the growing integration of smart technology in household appliances.

items.title: Temasek considers selling testing firm Element Materials
items.summary:
- Temasek Holdings is considering selling Element Materials Technology, a UK-based testing company.
- The company was acquired in 2022 for over US$7 billion, including debt.
- Temasek is working with advisers to gauge interest from potential buyers, including strategic firms.
- Element expanded by purchasing National Technical Systems, a US-based testing firm, in September 2022.
- Temasek declined to comment on the potential sale, and Element has not responded to inquiries.

items.title: How startups can make chatbots more than a digital dead end
items.summary:
- Businesses are investing billions in AI chatbots, with banks projected to spend US$18.4 billion by 2028.
- AI chatbots struggle with context, nuance, and complex queries, excelling only in structured interactions.
- A Gartner survey revealed only 14% of customer issues are resolved through self-service, indicating many AI solutions fall short.
- Overall effectiveness of chatbots scored 60%, with a resolution rate of 67%, allowing room for improvement, particularly in telecommunications.

items.title: Perplexity AI tackles user concerns as CEO assures stability plans
items.author: Aravind Srinivas
items.summary:
- Aravind Srinivas, CEO of Perplexity AI, addresses user concerns about product updates and performance issues in a Reddit post.
- Discussed the introduction of "Auto" mode to simplify user experience by auto-selecting the best AI model.
- Acknowledged user reports of inconsistencies, clarified that specific models are task-oriented, and announced plans to merge Pro and Reasoning modes.
- Highlighted infrastructure challenges causing user interface bugs and reliability issues; prioritizing infrastructure improvements.
- Transitioning from Python to GoLang and developing a more powerful deep research agent.
- Affirmed financial stability, increasing revenue, and no IPO plans before 2028.

items.title: Rebooted Taobao looks beyond China
items.author: Melissa Goh
items.summary:
- Taobao is launching an English app in nearly a dozen Asian markets to enhance the shopping experience for non-Chinese customers.
- The platform's initiatives aim to address previous pain points, such as language barriers and delivery challenges.
- Taobao faces competition from established regional players like Shopee, known for better returns and after-sales support.

items.title: 20 largest exits in Singapore
Student loan startup founder guilty of fraud in JPMorgan deal
items.summary:
- Charlie Javice, founder of Frank, found guilty of fraud on Mar. 28.
- Defrauded JPMorgan Chase during a US$175 million acquisition in 2021.
- Jury concluded she fabricated customer data, falsely claiming 4 million users instead of the 300,000 legitimate ones.
- Marketing emails revealed a 70% bounce rate, indicating fraud.
- Hired a math professor to create fake customer information.
- Facing a possible decades-long prison sentence; sentencing scheduled for August 2025.
- Founded Frank in 2017 to simplify financial aid applications; featured in Forbes’ 30 Under 30 list in 2019.

items.title: Amazon restructures leadership following streaming struggles
items.summary:
- Amazon confirmed the departure of Jennifer Salke as head of Amazon MGM Studios as part of a leadership streamlining effort.
- Film and TV studio heads will now report directly to Mike Hopkins, head of Amazon MGM Studios and Prime Video.
- Salke oversaw major projects like Reacher, Jack Ryan, The Boys, and Fallout since joining in 2018.
- Major investments, including The Rings of Power and Citadel, faced criticism for high costs and mixed reception.
- The Rings of Power cost over US$1 billion but did not achieve widespread global success.
- Amazon has encountered creative control issues with the James Bond franchise since acquiring MGM in 2022.
- Post-departure, Salke intends to establish her own film and TV production company with a first-look deal at Amazon.

items.title: OpenAI must go for-profit by 2025 to secure $40b
items.summary:
- OpenAI must become a for-profit entity by the end of 2025 to secure $40 billion in funding led by SoftBank.
- If the transition is not completed within the year, the funding may drop to $20 billion.
- This requirement is part of a two-year timeline set after OpenAI's last financing round.
- The company claims this shift is essential for funding advancements in its AI models.
- OpenAI has not provided any comments regarding this transition.

items.title: Rebel Foods eyes IPO in 2026
items.author: Ankush Grover
items.summary:
- Rebel Foods is considering a public listing in 2026 amid expansion efforts.
- The company operates 350 kitchens in 70 cities in India and has 27 international locations.
- Reports a 42% reduction in net loss to 378.2 crore rupee and 19% revenue growth to 1,420.2 crore rupee in FY24.
- Launch of QuickiES, a 15-minute food delivery service to compete with Zomato and Swiggy.
- Utilizes technology for food quality monitoring and employs over 8,000 staff with a focus on training.

items.title: Blackstone reportedly eyes TikTok US minority stake
items.summary:
- Blackstone is considering a minority investment in TikTok’s US operations.
- Discussions involve joining ByteDance’s non-Chinese shareholders like Susquehanna International Group and General Atlantic.
- The proposal aims to restructure TikTok’s US business and reduce Chinese ownership to below 20% for compliance with US regulations.

items.title: Indian Cocktail Brand O’Be Shuts Down After Struggle to Find Buyer
items.author: Nitesh Prakash
items.summary:
- O’Be Cocktails has ceased operations after failing to find a buyer for over a year.
- Founded in 2019, the brand specialized in ready-to-drink cocktails and operated in nine states, including Bengaluru and Goa.
- Investors included Ola co-founder Bhavish Aggarwal and Tracxn founder Abhishek Goyal.
- In 2023, O’Be Cocktails raised an undisclosed pre-series A round led by Inflection Point Ventures.
- Challenges in the Indian alcoholic beverage market were cited, including commoditization and price sensitivity affecting sustainability.

items.title: SpaceX allowed Chinese investments via offshore hubs
items.summary:
- SpaceX permits Chinese investors to buy stakes through offshore hubs like the Cayman Islands.
- Investments must be funneled through such entities to bypass direct investment restrictions.
- Iqbaljit Kahlon testified about raising funds from Chinese investors and channeling them to acquire SpaceX shares.
- A 2021 deal for a Chinese firm to buy $50 million in shares was canceled due to national security concerns after media scrutiny.
- SpaceX has no formal policy on foreign ownership but aims to avoid investors from adversarial nations.
- Experts raise alarms about using offshore entities potentially hiding foreign influence in sensitive technology areas.

items.title: Intel announces board retirements before shareholder meeting
items.author: Omar Ishrak, Tsu-Jae King Liu, Risa Lavizzo-Mourey
items.summary:
- Intel Corp. will see board members Omar Ishrak, Tsu-Jae King Liu, and Risa Lavizzo-Mourey retire.  
- They will not seek reelection at the annual shareholder meeting scheduled for May 6, reducing the board to 11 members.  
- This follows the addition of independent directors Eric Meurice and Steve Sanghi last year.  
- Chairman Frank Yeary emphasized the aim for a board with the right mix of skills and expertise.  
- The changes coincide with Lip-Bu Tan's appointment as CEO, following Pat Gelsinger's departure amid concerns over Intel’s recovery pace.  
- Details were provided in Intel’s annual proxy statement.
